00060         {

00066         double eval(const Array<double>& x1, const Array<double>& x2)
00067         {
00068                 SIZE_CHECK(x1.ndim() == 1);
00069                 SIZE_CHECK(x2.ndim() == 1);
00070                 RANGE_CHECK(x1.nelem() == x2.nelem());
00071 
00072                 return eval(x1.elemvec(), x2.elemvec(), x1.nelem());
00073         }
00074 
00076         double eval(const Array<double>& x1, const Array<double>& x2) const
00077         {
00078                 KernelFunction* pT = const_cast<KernelFunction*>(this);
00079                 return pT->eval(x1, x2);
00080         }
00081 
00084         virtual double evalDerivative(const double* x1, const double* x2, unsigned int dim, Array<double>& derivative)
00085         {
00086                 int i, ic = parameter.dim(0);
00087                 double temp;
00088                 double ret = eval(x1, x2, dim);
00089                 derivative.resize(ic, false);
00090                 for (i=0; i<ic; i++)
00091                 {
00092                         temp = parameter(i);
00093                         parameter(i) += epsilon;
00094                         derivative(i) = (eval(x1, x2, dim) - ret) / epsilon;
00095                         parameter(i) = temp;
00096                 }
00097                 return ret;
00098         }
00099 
00103         double evalDerivative(const double* x1, const double* x2, unsigned int dim, Array<double>& derivative) const
00104         {
00105                 KernelFunction* pT = const_cast<KernelFunction*>(this);
00106                 return pT->evalDerivative(x1, x2, dim, derivative);
00107         }

00111         double evalDerivative(const Array<double>& x1, const Array<double>& x2, Array<double>& derivative)
00112         {
00113                 SIZE_CHECK(x1.ndim() == 1);
00114                 SIZE_CHECK(x2.ndim() == 1);
00115                 SIZE_CHECK(x1.nelem() == x2.nelem());
00116 
00117                 return evalDerivative(x1.elemvec(), x2.elemvec(), x1.nelem(), derivative);

00132         void model(const Array<double>& input, Array<double> &output)
00133         {
00134                 output.resize(1, false);
00135                 output(0) = eval(input[0], input[1]);
00136         }

00140         void modelDerivative(const Array<double>& input, Array<double>& derivative)
00141         {
00142                 evalDerivative(input[0], input[1], derivative);
00143         }

00147         void modelDerivative(const Array<double>& input, Array<double> &output, Array<double>& derivative)
00148         {
00149                 output.resize(1, false);
00150                 output(0) = evalDerivative(input[0], input[1], derivative);
00151         }

00158 class LinearKernel : public KernelFunction
00159 {
00160 public:
00161         LinearKernel()
00162         {
00163                 parameter.resize(0, false);
00164         }
00165 
00166         ~LinearKernel()
00167         {
00168         }
00169 
00170 
00171         double eval(const double* x1, const double* x2, unsigned int dim) const
00172         {
00173                 unsigned int i;
00174                 double ret = 0.0;
00175                 for (i=0; i<dim; i++) ret += x1[i] * x2[i];
00176                 return ret;
00177         }
00178 
00179         double evalDerivative(const double* x1, const double* x2, unsigned int dim, Array<double>& derivative)
00180         {
00181                 derivative.resize(0, false);
00182                 return KernelFunction::eval(x1, x2, dim);
00183         }
00184 };

00188 class PolynomialKernel : public KernelFunction
00189 {
00190 public:
00191         PolynomialKernel(int degree, double offset)
00192         {
00193                 parameter.resize(2, false);
00194                 parameter(0) = degree;
00195                 parameter(1) = offset;
00196         }
00197 
00198         ~PolynomialKernel()
00199         {
00200         }
00201 
00202 
00203         double eval(const double* x1, const double* x2, unsigned int dim)
00204         {
00205                 unsigned int i;
00206                 double dot = 0.0;
00207                 for (i=0; i<dim; i++) dot += x1[i] * x2[i];
00208                 return pow(dot + parameter(0), parameter(1));
00209         }
00210 
00211         double evalDerivative(const double* x1, const double* x2, unsigned int dim, Array<double>& derivative)
00212         {
00213                 // TODO (later...)
00214                 // Only fill in the derivative w.r.t. the offset?
00215                 return 0.0;
00216         }
00217 };

00232 class RBFKernel : public KernelFunction
00233 {
00234 public:
00236         RBFKernel(double gamma)
00237         {
00238                 parameter.resize(1, false);
00239                 parameter(0) = gamma;
00240         }
00241 
00243         ~RBFKernel()
00244         {
00245         }
00246 
00247 
00249         double eval(const double* x1, const double* x2, unsigned int dim)
00250         {
00251                 double tmp, dist2 = 0.0;
00252                 unsigned int i;
00253                 for (i=0; i<dim; i++)
00254                 {
00255                         tmp = x1[i] - x2[i];
00256                         dist2 += tmp * tmp;
00257                 }
00258                 return exp(-parameter(0) * dist2);
00259         }
00260 
00262         double evalDerivative(const double* x1, const double* x2, unsigned int dim, Array<double>& derivative)
00263         {
00264                 derivative.resize(1, false);
00265                 double tmp, dist2 = 0.0;
00266                 unsigned int i;
00267                 for (i=0; i<dim; i++)
00268                 {
00269                         tmp = x1[i] - x2[i];
00270                         dist2 += tmp * tmp;
00271                 }
00272                 double ret = exp(-parameter(0) * dist2);
00273                 derivative(0) = -dist2 * ret;
00274                 return ret;
00275         }
00276 };

00279 //
00280 // ********************
00281 // ***  DECREPATED  ***
00282 // ********************
00283 //
00284 // This class is not available any more
00285 // because there is no systematic way to
00286 // incorporate class specific penalties
00287 // at the kernel level.
00288 // Please use the norm2-parameter of the
00289 // C_SVM class instead!
00290 //
00291 // /*!
00292 //  *
00293 //  *  \brief Kernel modification used for 2-norm C-SVM training
00294 //  *
00295 //  *  \par The Kernel2norm class modifies an existing kernel object
00296 //  *  in the following way:
00297 //  *  \f[
00298 //  *       k(x, z) = k_{base}(x, z) + \frac{1}{C} \delta_{x, z}
00299 //  *  \f]
00300 //  *  where \f$ \delta \f$ is the Kronecker delta which is 1 if
00301 //  *  x and z are equal and 0 otherwise.
00302 //  *  This kernel function allows for the training of a 2-norm
00303 //  *  C-SVM where C becomes a kernel parameter and the training
00304 //  *  is carried out in the hard margin case, which means
00305 //  *  \f$ C = \infty \f$.
00306 //  *
00307 //  *  \par The modified version of the kernel should only be used
00308 //  *  during training. For prediction the original function should
00309 //  *  be used. In practice, this will not make any difference, as
00310 //  *  the two version only differ on finitely many points, that is
00311 //  *  on the training set.
00312 //  *
00313 // */
00314 // class Kernel2norm : public KernelFunction
00315 // {
00316 // public:
00317 // //! Constructor
00318 //      Kernel2norm(KernelFunction* kernel, double C)
00319 //      {
00320 //              baseKernel = kernel;
00321 // 
00322 //              int k, kc = kernel->getParameterDimension();
00323 //              parameter.resize(kc + 1, false);
00324 //              for (k=0; k<kc; k++) parameter(k) = kernel->getParameter(k);
00325 //              parameter(kc) = C;
00326 //              factor_plus = 1.0;
00327 //              factor_minus = 1.0;
00328 //      }
00329 // 
00330 //      Kernel2norm(KernelFunction* kernel, double Cplus, double Cminus)
00331 //      {
00332 //              baseKernel = kernel;
00333 //              double C = sqrt(Cplus * Cminus);
00334 // 
00335 //              int k, kc = kernel->getParameterDimension();
00336 //              parameter.resize(kc + 1, false);
00337 //              for (k=0; k<kc; k++) parameter(k) = kernel->getParameter(k);
00338 //              parameter(kc) = C;
00339 //              factor_plus = Cplus / C;
00340 //              factor_minus = Cminus / C;
00341 //      }
00342 // 
00343 //      //! Destructor
00344 //      ~Kernel2norm()
00345 //      {
00346 //      }
00347 // 
00348 // 
00349 //      //! Computes the 2norm kernel
00350 //      double eval(const double* x1, const double* x2, unsigned int dim)
00351 //      {
00352 //              int kc = baseKernel->getParameterDimension();
00353 //              double ret = baseKernel->eval(x1, x2, dim);
00354 //              unsigned int d;
00355 //              for (d=0; d<dim; d++) if (x1[d] != x2[d]) break;
00356 //              if (d == dim)
00357 //              {
00358 //                      ret += 1.0 / parameter(kc);
00359 //              }
00360 //              return ret;
00361 //      }
00362 // 
00363 //      //! Computes the 2norm kernel and its derivative
00364 //      double evalDerivative(const double* x1, const double* x2, unsigned int dim, Array<double>& derivative)
00365 //      {
00366 //              int k, kc = baseKernel->getParameterDimension();
00367 //              derivative.resize(kc + 1, false);
00368 //              Array<double> baseDerivative;
00369 //              double ret = baseKernel->evalDerivative(x1, x2, dim, baseDerivative);
00370 //              for (k=0; k<kc; k++) derivative(k) = baseDerivative(k);
00371 //              unsigned int d;
00372 //              for (d=0; d<dim; d++) if (x1[d] != x2[d]) break;
00373 //              if (d == dim)
00374 //              {
00375 //                      double f = 1.0 / parameter(kc);
00376 //                      ret += f;
00377 //                      derivative(kc) = -f*f;
00378 //              }
00379 //              else derivative(kc) = 0.0;
00380 //              return ret;
00381 //      }
00382 // 
00383 //      void setParameter(unsigned int index, double value)
00384 //      {
00385 //              if (index == baseKernel->getParameterDimension())
00386 //                      parameter(index) = fabs(value);
00387 //              else
00388 //              {
00389 //                      parameter(index) = value;
00390 //                      baseKernel->setParameter(index, value);
00391 //              }
00392 //      }
00393 // 
00394 // protected:
00395 //      KernelFunction* baseKernel;
00396 //      double factor_plus;
00397 //      double factor_minus;
00398 // };
